dialogues.text: (Itarration) Our last night on the island. I draw fire watch. JOKER hears a muffled sound. He isn't sure where it comes from. He slowly enters the latrine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running his flashlight across the room JOKER Sees PYLE sitting ona toilet, loading a magazine for his M-14 rifle. PYLE looks up at JOKER and smiles. It is a frightening smile.

dialogues.speaker: PYLE
dialogues.text: (strange voice)  Hi, Joker. JOKER stares at PYLE for a few seconds. PYLE has suite clearly snapped.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Are those ... live rounds?

dialogues.speaker: PYLE
dialogues.text: Seven-six-two millimeter, full metal jacket. PYLE smiles grotesquely.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Leonard .. . if Hartman comes in here and catches us, we'll both be in a world of shit.

dialogues.speaker: PYLE
dialogues.text: Iam... inaworld.. . of shit! PYLE gets to his feet, snaps his rifle to port arms, and starts executing the Manual ofArms.

dialogues.speaker: PYLE
dialogues.text: (shouting) Left shoulder ... hut! Right shoulder hut! Lock and load! Order ... hut! PYLE picks up the loaded magazine, inserts it into the rifle and smartly brings the rifle down to the order arms position.

dialogues.speaker: PYLE
dialogues.text: (shouting) This is my rifle! There are many like it, but this one is mine.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: By now the platoon is awake. HARTMAN bursts from his room, wearing his  skivvies and D.I. hat.

dialogues.speaker: PYLE
dialogues.text: (offscreen) My rifle is my best friend! It is my life!

dialogues.speaker: HARTMAN
dialogues.text: Get back in your bunks!

dialogues.speaker: PYLE
dialogues.text: (o.s.) I must master it as I must master my life! Without me 50 INT.

dialogues.speaker: LATRINES
dialogues.text: HARTMAN Storms into the latrine.

dialogues.speaker: HARTMAN
dialogues.text: What is this Mickey Mouse shit? What in the name of Jesus H. Christ are you animals doing in my head? (to JOKER) Why is Private Pyle out of his bunk after lights out?! Why is Private Pyle holding that weapon? Why aren't you stomping Private Pyle's guts out?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Sir, it is the private's duty to inform the Senior Drill Instructor that Private Pyie has a full Magazine and has locked and loaded, sir! HARTMAN and PYLE look at each other. PYLE Smiles from the depths of his own hell. HARTMAN focuses all of his considerable powers of intimidation, into his best John- Wayne-on-Suribachi voice.

dialogues.speaker: HARTMAN
dialogues.text: Now you listen to me, Private Pyle, and, you  listen good. I want that weapon, and I want it now! You will place that rifle on the deck at your feet and step back away from it. With a twisted smile on his face pyLE POintS his rifle at HARTMAN. HARTMAN look suddenly calm. His eyes, his manner are those of a wanderer who has found his home.

dialogues.speaker: HARTMAN
dialogues.text: What is your major malfunction, numbnuts?!! Didn't Mommy and Daddy show you enough attention when you were a child?!!!

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The round hits HARTMAN in the chest. He falls back dead. JOKER and PYLE stand looking at the body. Then PYLE looks at JoKER and slowly raises his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (trembling) Easy, Leonard. Go easy, man. PYLE breathes heavily, and Keeps the rifle aimed at JOKER. JOKER is scared shitless. PYLE looks at JOKER for several seconds and slowly lowers the rifle. Then he stumbles back a few steps and sits down, heavily on the toilet. PYLE turns away from JOKER and stares into space, a strangely peaceful look transforming his face. He places the muzzle of the rifle in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!!

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: PYLE pulls the trigger and blows the back of his head over the white tiled wall behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motorcycles, cars, Vietnamese civilians. Swinging her hips ruith exaggerated sexiness, an attractive HOOKER in a mini-skirt walks toward a cafe' table on the pavement ulhere JOKER and RAFTERMAN are seated. Music: Nancy Sinatra's "These Boots Are Made for Walking." The girl stops at JOKER's table.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Hey, baby, you got girlfriend Vietnam?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Not just this minute.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Well, baby, me so horny. Me so horny. Me love you long time. You party?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Yeah, we might party. How much?

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Fifteen dolla.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Fifteen dollars for both of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Each you fifteen dolla. Me love you long time. Me so horny.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Fifteen dollar too boo-coo. Five dollars each.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Me suckee-suckee. Me love you too much.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Five dollars is all my mom allows me to spend.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Okay! Ten dolla each.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: What do we get for ten dollars?

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Everything you want.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Everything?

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Well, old buddy, feel like spending some of your hard-earned money?

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Just a minute. RAFTERMAN raises his Nikon and starts photographing JOKER and the HOOKER. The girl strikes quick poses for the camera and coughs. JOKER puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: You  know, half these gook whores are serving officers in the Viet Cong. The girl coughs again.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: The other half have got T.B. Make sure you only fuck the ones that cough. A young vietnamese boy walks up behind RAFTERMAN and grabs the Nikon camera from his hands. The boy runs to an accomplice sitting on a waiting motorbike and tosses the camera to him. Then in mockery the BOY excecutes a few, Bruce Lee moves before jumping on the bike and zooming off: JOKER laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main gates of the base. High-security fencing. Tanks, jeeps, trucks. A military helicopter lands.

dialogues.speaker: BASE-
dialogues.text: JOKER and RAFTERMAN walk down the base street past rows of hootches and other buildings. In the background some marines play basketball.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: That little sucker really had some moves on him, didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Yeah ... You know what really pisses me off about these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: We're supposed to be helping them and they shit all over us every chance they get ... I just can't feature that.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Don't take it too hard, Rafterman. It's just business.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: I hate Da Nang, Joker. I want to go out into the field. I've been in this country almost three months, and all I do is take handshake shots at awards ceremonies.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: You get wasted your first day in the field and it'd be my fault.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: A high school girl could do my job. I want to get out into the shit. I want to get some trigger time.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: If you get killed, your mom will find me after I rotate back to the world and she'll beat the shit out of me. That's a negative, Rafterman. 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Quonset hut. An editorial meeting of The Sea Tiger, the official marine newspaper, is in progress presided over by LIEUTENANT LOCKHART. JOKER, RAFTERMAN, and six other marine correspondens are seated around a large messy table covered with  cameras, photographs, newspapers artd magazines.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Okay, guys, let's keep it short and sweet today. Anybody got anything new?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: There's a rumor going around that the Tet ceasefire is gonna be cancelled.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Rear-echelon paranoia.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: A bro in Intelligence says Charlie might try to pull off something big during the Tet holiday.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: They say the same thing every year.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: There's a lot of talk about it, sir.

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: wouldn't lose any sleep over it. The Tet holiday's like the Fourth of July, Christmas and New Year all rolled into one. Every zipperhead in Nam, North and South, will be banging gongs, barking at the moon and visiting his dead relatives.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: All right ...Ann-Margret and entourage are due here next week. I want someone to be there on the airfield and stick with her for a couple of days. Uh, Rafterman, you take it.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Aye-aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Get me some good low-angle stuff. Don't make it too obvious, but I want to see fur and early morning dew.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: (reading) "Diplomats in Dungarees--Marine engineers lend a helping hand rebuilding Dong Phuc villages . . ." Chili, if we move Vietnamese, they are evacuees. If they come to us to be evacuated, they are refugees.

dialogues.speaker: CHILI
dialogues.text: I'll make a note of it, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: (reading) "N.V.A. Soldier Deserts After Reading Pamphlets --A young North Vietnamese Army regular, who realized his side could not win the war, deserted from his unit after reading Open Arms program pamphlets." That's good, Dave. But why say North Vietnamese Army regular? Is there an irregular? How about North Vietnamese Army soldier?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'll fix it up, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Lawrence Welk Show's gonna go out on TV in two weeks. Dave, do a hundred words on it. AFTV'1l give you some background stuff.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: (reading) "Not While We're Eating--N.V.A. learn marines on a search and destroy mission don't like to be interrupted while eating chow." Search and destroy. Uh, we have a new directive from M.A.F. on this. In the future, in place of"search and destroy," substitute the phrase "sweep and clear." Got it?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Got it. Very catchy.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: And, Joker ... where's the weenie?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Sir!

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: The Kill, JOKER. The kill. I mean, all that fire, the grunts must've hit something.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Didn't see em.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Joker, I've told you, we run two basic stories here. Grunts who give half their pay to buy gooks toothbrushes and deodorants--Winning of Hearts and Minds--okay? And combat action that results in a kill--Winning the War. Now you must have seen blood trails ... drag marks?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: It was raining, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Well, that's why God passed the law of probability. Now rewrite it and give ita happy ending--say, uh, one kill. Make it a sapper or  an officer. which?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Whichever you say.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Grunts like reading about dead officers.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Okay, an officer. How about a general? A few laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Joker, maybe you'd like our guys to read the paper and feel bad. I mean, in case you didn't know it, this is nota particularly popular war. Now, it is our job to report the news that these why-are-we-here civilian newsmen ignore.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Sir, maybe you should go out on some ops yourself. I'm sure you could find a lot more blood trails and drag marks. Some laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: JOKER, I've had my ass in the grass. Can't say I liked it much. Lots of bugs and too dangerous. As it happens, my present duties keep me where I belong. In the rear with the gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of hootches. In the distance, fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (voiceover ) Tet. The Year of the Monkey. Vietnamese Lunar New Year's Eve. Down in Dogpatch, the gooks are shooting off fireworks to celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOKER, RAFTERMAN, PAYBACK and the others are in their bunks, reading, lazing, smoking grass. JOKER is writing in a notebook.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (yawns and stretches) I am fucking bored to death, man. I gotta get back in the shit. I ain't heard a shot fired in anger in weeks.

dialogues.speaker: PAYBACK
dialogues.text: Joker's so tough he'd eat the boogers out of a dead man's nose ... then ask for seconds. Some laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (John Wayne voice) Listen up, pilgrim. A day without blood is like a day without sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: PAYBACK
dialogues.text: Shi-i--i-t! Joker thinks the bad bush is between old mama-san's legs. Some laughs.

dialogues.speaker: PAYBACK
dialogues.text: He's never been in the shit. It's hard to talk about it, man. It's like on Hastings.

dialogues.speaker: CHILI
dialogues.text: Aw, you weren't on Operation Hastings,  Payback. You weren't even in country.

dialogues.speaker: PAYBACK
dialogues.text: Eat shit and die, you fucking Spanish- American! You fucking poge! I was there, man. I was in the shit with the grunts.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (John Wayne voice) Don't listen to any of Payback's bullshit, Rafterman. Sometimes he thinks he's John Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: PAYBACK
dialogues.text: You listen to Joker, new guy. He knows ti ti. Very little. You know he's never been in the shit, 'cause he ain't got the stare.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: The stare?

dialogues.speaker: PAYBACK
dialogues.text: The thousand-yard stare. A marine gets it after he's been in the shit for too long. It's like . it's like you've really seen beyond. I got it. All field marines got it. And you'll have it too.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: I will?

dialogues.speaker: STORK
dialogues.text: Hey, Payback. How do you stop five black dudes from raping a white chick?

dialogues.speaker: PAYBACK
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Stork.

dialogues.speaker: STORK
dialogues.text: Throw'em a basketball. Laughter. They are startled by the dull boom of mortar  shells outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming.

dialogues.speaker: PAYBACK
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: CHILI
dialogues.text: They're outgoing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: That ain't outgoing! Some closer explosions, much louder.

dialogues.speaker: CHILI
dialogues.text: That ain't outgoing!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Now what I just say? The men grab their helmets, flak jackets and weapons and run outside.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Joker, is this for real?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Yes, it is, Rafterman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men running everywhere. Sirens. A mortar round lands in the distance, then others nearer. Fires are breaking out.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: loads an M-60 machine gun, then hunches down watching the main gate of the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Hey, I hope they're just fucking with us. I ain't ready for this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. The sound ofa truck approaching. The marines get set. The truch smashes though the gates. The marines open fire. The truck is hit by a hail of automatic fire; it explodes and starts burning. N.V.A. troops follow the truck through the gate. The attackers are cut down by a withering fire from the marines. The attack peters out. People yell, "Cease fire." The firing trails off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOKER and RAFTERMAN walk through the wreckage of the night's battle. Prisoners are led past.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: (voice over) The enemy has very deceitfully taken advantage of the Tet ceasefire to launch an offensive all over the country. So far, we've had it pretty easy here. But we seem to be the exception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirty and still in. their combat gear, JOKER, RAFTERMAN, PAYBACK and the other correspondents are slumped in, their chairs around the table.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: (walking) Charlie has hit every major military target in Vietnam, and hit 'em hard. In Saigon, the United States Embassy has been overrun by suicide squads. Khe Sahn is standing by to be overrun. We also have reports that a divi- sion of N.V.A. has occupied all of the city of Hue south of the Perfume River. In strate- gic terms, Charlie's cut the country in half... the civilian press are about to wet their pants and we've heard even Cronkite's going to say the war is now unwinnable. In other words, it's a huge shit sandwich, and we're all gonna have to take a bite. Long, serious pause.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Sir ... does this mean that Ann-Margret's not coming? Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: (pissed off) Joker.... I want you to get straight up to Phu Bai. Captain January will need all his people.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: And Joker, you will take off that damn button. How's it gonna look if you get killed wearing  a peace symbol?

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Sir? Permission to go with Joker?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Permission granted.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Sir, permission not to take Rafterman with me?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: You still here? Vanish, Joker, most ricky-tick, and take Rafterman with you. You're responsible for him.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: military helicopter flies past a huge sun.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER- -DUSK
dialogues.text: JOKER Sits looking out the door. RAFTERMAN is frightened and airsick. The DOORGUNNER laughs and yells as he fires his M-60 machine gun. We see Vietnamese below running and falling.

dialogues.speaker: DOORGUNNER
dialogues.text: Get some ... get some ... get some ... get some yeah ... yeah ... get some ... get some. After a while the DOORGUNNER stops firing and grins at JOKER.

dialogues.speaker: DOORGUNNER
dialogues.text: (shouting to be heard) Anyone who runs is a V.C. Anyone who stands still is a well-disciplined v.Cc. (laughs) You guys oughtta do a story about me sometime.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Why should we do a story about you?

dialogues.speaker: DOORGUNNER
dialogues.text: "Cause I'm so fucking good! That ain't no shit neither. I've done got me one hundred and fifty-seven dead gooks killed. And fifty water buffaloes, too. Them're all certified. RAFTERMAN gags.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Any women or children?

dialogues.speaker: DOORGUNNER
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: How can you shoot women and children? RAFTERMAN gags.

dialogues.speaker: DOORGUNNER
dialogues.text: Easy. You just don't lead 'em so much. (laughs) Ain't war hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter lands. JOKER and RAFTERMAN jump out, duck down low and move away through pink smoke blown by the rotor blades.  Marines run by carrying wounded on stretchers.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (toa sergeant ) Top, we want to get in the shit.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Down the road, two-five.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Two-five. Outstanding! Thanks, Top.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: road next to a small canal on the outskirts of Hue. Tanks, trucks and marines are moving into the city past a column of refugees heading the other way. JOKER and RAFTERMAN catch up to a Lieutenant, salute him and walk alongside.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Excuse me! Sir ... we're looking for First Platoon, Hotel two-five. I got a bro named Cowboy there.

dialogues.speaker: TOUCHDOWN
dialogues.text: You people one-one?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: No, sir. We're reporters for Stars and Stripes.

dialogues.speaker: TOUCHDOWN
dialogues.text: Stars and Stripes.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: TOUCHDOWN
dialogues.text: I'm Cowboy's platoon commander. Cowboy's  just down the road in the platoon area.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Oh. You mind if we tag along, sir?

dialogues.speaker: TOUCHDOWN
dialogues.text: No problem. Welcome aboard. By the way, my name's Schinoski. Walter J. Schinoski. My people call me Mister Touchdown. I played a little ball for Notre Dame.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Notre Dame?

dialogues.speaker: TOUCHDOWN
dialogues.text: (laughing) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: All right!

dialogues.speaker: TOUCHDOWN
dialogues.text: You here to make Cowboy famous?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Ha! Never happen, sir.

dialogues.speaker: TOUCHDOWN
dialogues.text: Well, if you people came looking for a story, this is your lucky day. We got Condition Red and we're definitely expecting rain.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Outstanding, sir. We taking care of business?

dialogues.speaker: TOUCHDOWN
dialogues.text: Well, the N.V.A. are dug in deep. Hotel Company's still working this side of the river. Street by street and house by house. Charlie's definitely got his shit together. But we're still getting some really decent kills here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard some scuttlebutt, sir, about the N.V.A. executing a lot of gook civilians.

dialogues.speaker: TOUCHDOWN
dialogues.text: That's affirmative. I saw some bodies about half a klick this side of Phu Cam Canal.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Can you show me where, sir?

dialogues.speaker: TOUCHDOWN
dialogues.text: Here's the canal...

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: stands looking down into a large open grave at a row of white, lime-covered corpses. Journalists, marines and civilians are grouped around the grave. A work detail leans on their shovels, their faces covered with bandanas against the stench.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (voice over) The dead have been covered with lime. The dead only know one thing. It is better to be alive. JOKER approaches a young lieutenant-- CLEVES.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Good morning, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: LT. CLEVES
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: I make it twenty. Is that the official body count, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) What outfit are you men with?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Sir, we're reporters from Stars and Stripes. LT.

dialogues.speaker: CLEVES
dialogues.text: (warms up) Oh, I see.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: I'm Sergeant Joker and this photographer's Rafterman.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: starts shooting pictures of the Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: LT. CLEVES
dialogues.text: I'm Lieutenant Cleves. I'm from Hartford, Connecticut.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Have you got a body count, sir?

dialogues.speaker: LT. CLEVES
dialogues.text: We think it's twenty.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Do you know how it happened, sir?

dialogues.speaker: LT. CLEVES
dialogues.text: Well, it seems the N.V.A. came in with a list of gook names. Government officials, policemen, ARVN officers, schoolteachers. They went around their houses real polite and asked them to report the next day for political re-education. Everybody who turned up got shot. Some they buried alive. A marine COLONEL who has been watching JOKER turns from the group arourzd the grave and strides  up. JOKER snaps to attention.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: Marine !

dialogues.speaker: LT. CLEVES
dialogues.text: Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: Marine, what is that button on your body armor?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: A peace symbol, sir.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: I don't remember, sir.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: What is that you've got written on your helmet?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: "Born to Kill," sir.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: You write "Born to Kill" on your helmet and you wear a peace button. What's that supposed to be, some kind of sick joke?!

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: You'd better get your head and your ass wired together, or I will take a giant shit on you!

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: Now answer my question or you'll be standing  tall before the man.

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: think I was trying to suggest something about the duality of man, sir.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: The duality of man. The Jungian thing, sir.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: Whose side are you on, son?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Our side, sir.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: Don't you love your country?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: Then how about getting with the program? Why don't you jump on the team and come on in for the big win?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: Son, all I've ever asked of my marines is that they obey my orders as they would the word of God. We are here to help the Vietnamese, because inside every gook there is an American trying to get out. It's a hardball world, son. We've gotta keep our heads until this peace craze blows over.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Aye-aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: FIELD- -DAY
dialogues.text: JOKER and RAFTERMAN Walk through a field toward a pagoda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marines are moving supplies. Some men are rest- ing on the ground. A helicopter flies overhead. Music: Sam the Sham's "Wooly Bully."

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Hey, bro, we're looking for First Platoon, Hotel two-five.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: Around the back. JOKER and RAFTERMAN lualk to the back of the building.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (to another marine) First Platoon?

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: Yeah, through there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a moon-door opening on to the pagoda courtyard, We see COWBOY shauing. Other marines are sprawled around the courtyard walls. JOKER walks up behind COWBOY.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Hey, Lone Ranger.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: You old motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: It's the JOKER.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: What's happenin'? They hug each other.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Boy, I hoped I'd never see you again, you piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (laughs) What's happening, man?

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm just waiting to get back to the land of the big PX.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, why go back? Here or there, samey-same.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Been getting any?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Only your sister.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Well, better my sister than my mom, though my mom's not bad. COWBOY leads JOKER to the center of the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: This is my bro Joker from the Island. And this is...

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Rafterman.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: ...Rafterman. They're from Stars and Stripes. They'll make you famous. Adlibs of "All right!"

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: We're the Lusthog Squad. We're life-takers and heartbreakers. Adlibs.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: We shoot em full of holes and fill 'em full of lead. Adlibs of "Yeah!" etc. A big grunt, ANIMAL MOTHER, approaches JOKER. Trouble.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Are you a photographer?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: No... I'm a combat correspondent.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: (smiles) Oh, you seen much combat? JOKER returns the smile.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Well, I've seen a little on TV. The other marines laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: You're a real comedian. Some more laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (pause) Well, they call me the JOKER.  Adlibs. "Qooo0000000!" and laughter.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: (moves closer) Well, I got a joke for you. I'm gonna tear you a new asshole. Adlibs, laughter.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (John. Wayne voice) Well, pilgrim ... only after you ... eat the peanuts out of my shit! Loud laughs and shouts.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: (moves in close) You talk the talk. Do you walk the walk? Anticipatory adlibs of "Ooooh!" and "Whoooa!" EIGHTBALL, a black grunt, gets up and steps between JOKER and ANIMAL MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: (to JOKER) Now you might not believe it but under fire Animal Mother is one of the finest human beings in the world. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: All he needs is somebody to throw hand grenades at him the rest of his life. Laughter. EIGHTBALL leads ANIMAL MOTHER away.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (laughing) Come on, sit down. Come on, new guy. EIGHTBALL and ANIMAL MOTHER sit down together.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hey, jungle bunny. Thank God for the sickle cell, huh?

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Yeah, mother. CRAZY EARL sits on the ground next toa figure sprawled in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY EARL
dialogues.text: Hey ... photographer! You want to take a good picture? Here, man ... take this. This is my bro. CRAZY EARL lifts the hat which has been, covering the man's face. We see he is a dead N.V.A. soldier. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY EARL
dialogues.text: This is his party. He's the guest of honor. Today ... is his birthday. Adlibs: "Happy Birthday, zipperhead!" etc.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY EARL
dialogues.text: I will never forget this day. The day I came to Hue City and fought one million N.V.A. gooks. I love the little Commie bastards, man, I really do. These enemy grunts are as hard as slant-eyed drill instructors. These are great days we're living, bros!'wWe are jolly green giants, walking the earth with guns. These people we wasted here today ... are the finest human beings we will ever know.  After we rotate back to the world, we're gonna miss not having anyone around that's worth shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COWBOY's platoon, advancing towards the city ina sweep formation behind tanks. Cuts of the squad, nervous and alert. Mortar rounds explode ahead. LIEUTENANT TOUCHDOWN is hit and goes down. The platoon dives for cover. DOC JAY crawls to him and starts mouth-to-mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: MURPHY crawls up, has a look, moves to the back of the tank and picks up a field radio. The platoon stays flat.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Delta Six Actual, this is Murphy. Over. Delta Six Actual, this is Murphy. Over.

dialogues.speaker: DELTA SIX
dialogues.text: (0.s.) Delta Six.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Delta Six, we are receiving incoming fire from the ville. The Lieutenant is down. We're going to stop here and check out what's in front of us. Over. CRAZY EARL, keeping low, scrambles up to the LUSTHOG SQUAD.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY EARL
dialogues.text: Okay.  Lusthog Squad, listen up! We're gonna move up these two roads here and check the ville. I want the third team up this road here. First and second fire team behind me up this other road, okay? Adlibs of "Right!" and "Okay!"

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY EARL
dialogues.text: Let's go! Let's get it done! Bending low the squad moves out past the tanks, leapfrogging toward some ruined buildings a couple of hundred yards in front of them. HAND JOB peers cautiously around the corner of a house and is killed instantly by a burst of automatic fire.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL
dialogues.text: MOTHER opens fire with his M-60 machine gun at some windows where the shots came from. Everyone opens fire, blasting chunks out of the building with a zillion rounds. T.H.E. ROCK fires an M-79 grenade, blowing out a window. RAFTERMAN photographs the action, his Nikon violently shaking. The fire slackens. Then it gets quiet. All their senses alert, everyone watches the building, listening hard. They reload. As CRAZY EARL reloads he spots six V.C. dashing across the street fifty yards away. They are out of  sight in a second. Having missed his first chance, CRAZY EARL gets set hoping for another. Two more V.C. rush out into the open. He fires a long burst from his M-16 and they both go down. CRAZY EARL turns to the squad with a big grin. Music: "Surfin' Bird" by the Trashmen. This car- ries over through the next scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The platoon are hunched down behind a low wall. Tanks fire at some distant buildings. A three-man TV crew, ducking low, moves past them, filming.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (John Wayne voice) Is that you, John Wayne? Is this me?

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Hey, start the cameras. This is "vietnam- - the Movie!"

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Yeah, Joker can be John Wayne. I'll be a horse!

dialogues.speaker: DONLON
dialogues.text: T.H.E. Rock can be a rock!

dialogues.speaker: T.H.E. ROCK
dialogues.text: I'll be Ann-Margret!

dialogues.speaker: DOC JAY
dialogues.text: Animal Mother can be a rabid buffalo!

dialogues.speaker: EARL.
dialogues.text: I'll be General Custer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who'll be the Indians?

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hey, we'll let the gooks play the Indians! Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bodies of LIEUTENANT TOUCHDOWN and HAND JOB laid out on ground sheets. The LUSTHOG SQUAD are gathered around them. The camera moves to each man, pausing for them to speak.

dialogues.speaker: T.H.E. ROCK
dialogues.text: You're going home now. Camera move.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY EARL
dialogues.text: Semper fi. Camera move.

dialogues.speaker: DONLON
dialogues.text: We're mean marines, sir. Camera move.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Go easy, bros. Camera move.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Better you than me.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Well, at least they died for a good cause.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: What cause was that?

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Freedom.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Flush out your head gear, new guy. You think we waste gooks for freedom? This is a slaughter. If I'm gonna get my balls blown off for a word ... my word is "poontang."

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Tough break for Hand Job. He was all set to get shipped out ona medical.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: What was the matter with him?

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: He was jerkin' off ten times a day.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: It's no shit. At least ten times a day.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Last week he was sent down to Da Nang to see the Navy head shrinker, and the crazy fucker starts jerking off in the waiting room. Instant Section Eight. He was just waiting for his papers to clear division.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television crew interviews members of the LUSTHOG SQUAD.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERAMAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Turnover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Hue City interviews. Roll thirty-four.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Well ... like, like you see, you know, it's a major city, so we have to assault with, uh tanks. So, they send us in first squad to make sure that there are no little Vietnamese waiting with, like, B-40 rockets that blow the tanks away. So we clear it out and we roll the tanks in and ... basically, blow the place to hell. (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: When we're in Hue ... when we're in Hue City it's like a war. You know like what I thought about a war, what I thought a war was, was supposed to be. There's the enemy, kill em.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Well, I don't think there's any question about it. I mean we're the best. I mean all that bullshit about the Air Cav ... When the shit really hits the fan, who do they call? They call Mother Green and her killing machine!

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY EARL
dialogues.text: Do I think America belongs in Vietnam? Um I don't know. I belong in Vietnam. I'll tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: DOC JAY
dialogues.text: Can I quote L.B.J.?

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: DOC JAY
dialogues.text: (imitating L.B.J.) "I will not send American boys eight or ten thousand miles around the world to do a job that Asian boys oughtta be doin' for themselves."

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Personally, I think, uh ... they don't really want to be involved in this war. I mean they sort of took away our freedom and gave it to the, to the gookers, you know. But they don't want it. They'd rather be alive than free, I guess. Poor dumb bastards.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Well, the ones I'm I'm fighting at are some pretty bad boys. I'm not real keen on some of these fellows that are . . . supposed to be on our side. I keep meeting'em coming the other way. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DONLON
dialogues.text: I mean, we're getting killed for these people and they don't even appreciate it. They think it's a big joke.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Well, if you ask me, uh, we're shooting the wrong gooks.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Well, it depends on the situation. I mean, I'm--I'm here to take combat photos. But if the shit gets too thick, I mean, I'll go to the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: What do I think about America's involvement in the war? Well, I think we should win.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: I hate Vietnam. There's not one horse in this whole country. They don't have one horse in Vietnam. There's something basically wrong with that. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Well, if they'd send us more guys and maybe bomb the hell out of the North, they might, uh they might give up.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: I wanted to see exotic Vietnam, the jewel of Southeast Asia. I wanted to meet interesting and stimulating people of an ancient culture and ... kill them. I wanted to be the first kid on my block to get a confirmed kill. 73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marines are seated outside the theater on rows of broken movie seats. A motor-scooter, driven by a young ARVN soldier with a pretty teenage Vietnamese HOOKER sitting behind him, and pulls up in front of the LUSTHOG SQUAD . The girl gets off slowly, swinging her hips as she walks. Adlibs, hoots anal hollers.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Ten-hut! More hoots and hollers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, little schoolgirl. I'm a little schoolboy, too. Adlibs and laughter.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: What you got there, chief! The girl stands facing them, hands on hips.

dialogues.speaker: PIMP.
dialogues.text: Do you want number one fuckee? Adlibs and laughter.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Hey, any of you boys want number one fuckee? Adlibs.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm so horny. I can't even get a piece of hand.

dialogues.speaker: DONLON
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! Me want suckee. ARVN PIMP. Suckee, fuckee, smoke cigarette in the pussy, she give you everything you want. Long time. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Everything you want! All right! How much there, chief! ARVN PIMP. Fifteen dolla each. Adlibs: "Nooooooo!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number ten. Fifteen dolla beaucoup money. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Five dolla each. ARVN PIMP. Come on. She love you good. Boom-boom long time. Ten dolla.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Five dolla. ARVN PIMP. No. Ten dolla.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Be glad to trade you some ARVN rifles. Never been fired and only dropped once. Laughter and derisive adlibs.

dialogues.speaker: PIMP.
dialogues.text: (angry) Okay, five dolla. You give me. Adlibs.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Okay, okay! EIGHTBALL, a black grunt, walks up to the girl.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Let's get mounted.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: (speaks in Vietnamese) ARVN PIMP. (argues in Vietnamese)

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Something wrong there, chief?  ARVN PIMP. She says, uh, no boom-boom with soul brotha.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Hey, what the mother fuck? ARVN PIMP. She say soul brotha too boo-coo. Too boo-coo.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Hey, what is this, man?

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (breaiting up) I think what he's trying to tell you is that you black boys pack too much meat. Laughter. ARVN PIMP. Too boo-coo. Too boo-coo.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Oh, shi-i-i-t! (laughs) This baby-san looks like she could suck the chrome off a trailer hitch. Laughter. ARVN PIMP. She say too boo-coo. Too boo-coo.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Uh, excuse me, ma'am. Now what we have here, little yellow sister, is a magnificent... (takes out his dick) specimen of pure Alabama blacksnake. But it ain't too goddamn boo-coo. The girl looks at it. Hoots and  catcalls.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE HOOKER
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. Emjee. More hoots.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (mimicking Vietnamese word) Okay! Okay! Emjee! Emjee! Adlibs of "Emjee." EIGHTBALL starts to lead her away.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: All right! This is my boogie!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Hey, we need a batting order. ANIMAL MOTHER grabs the girl's arm, EIGHTBALL holds on to the other one.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: I'm going first.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Hey, now back off, white bread. Don't get between a dog and his meat.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL
dialogues.text: MOTHER slaps EIGHTBALL on the wrist like he's a naughty boy and pushes the girl into the movie theater.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: (jokingly) All fucking niggers must fucking hang. Adlibs of "Fuck you!" and laughter.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hey, hey! I won't be long. I'll skip the foreplay.

dialogues.speaker: RUINS
dialogues.text: The LUSTHOG SQUAD on patrol moves slowly in single file, fifteen yards apart, through the ruined, smouldering city.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (voiceouer ) Intelligence passed the word down that during the night the N.V.A. had pulled out of our area to positions across the Perfume River. Our squad is sent on patrol to check out the report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrol moves carefully through the gutted shell of a building. The clink of their gear as they walk sounds loud in the unnatural silence.

dialogues.speaker: CRAZY
dialogues.text: EARL stops to pick up a child's stuffed toy.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The toy triggs a booby trap, blasting CRAZY EARL across the room. The squad dives for couer.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Face outboard and take cover! Do it! DOC JAY scurries up to CRAZY EARL, who is unconscious and gives him mouth-to-mouth resuscitation. COWBOY scrambles up to them. He looks at CRAZY EARL. Then JOKER runs in.

dialogues.speaker: DOC JAY
dialogues.text: (stops for a second) He aidt gonna make it.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (to himself) Shit. COWBOY doesn't know, what to do. Then he fumbles for his field radio.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Hotel One Actual, this is Cowboy! DOC JAY continues the mouth-to-mouth.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Hotel One Actual, this is Cowboy!

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Hotel One. Over

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Murph, this is Cowboy. Craze is hit. Booby trap.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Roger. Understand. Wait One. COWBOY looks around edgily.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (0.s.) You're senior N.C.0. You take charge and continue on with the patrol. Call in at the next checkpoint. Over.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Roger. Out. COWBOY stares at the radio. He looks scared. He turns to JOKER.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: I'm squad leader.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: punches him reassuringly in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: I'll follow you anywhere, scumbag. DOC JAY stops working over CRAZY EARL and slowly looks up.

dialogues.speaker: DOC JAY
dialogues.text: He's dead. The three men stare at the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad moves past a burning five-storey building that has collapsed and is lying on its side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGHTBALL, on point, studies a map as he walks. Then he slours to a stop and signals to halt the squad. The squad stops ancl crouches down in the rubble. EIGHTBALL gestures for COWBOY to move up.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: (quietly) Cowboy! COWBOY moves up and they kneel behind a low concrete wall.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: I think we made a mistake at the last checkpoint.  He shows COWBOY the map.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Here ... see what you think. I think we're here and we should be here.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: studies the map.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: We're here?

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: We should be here?

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Yeah ...yeah ... that's right. COWBOY is confused and scared. He checks his compass. Then he peers over the wall through his binoculars. COWBOY looks back nervously at the squacl strung out behind him.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Fuck ... What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Well, I think we should change direction.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: doesn't sound like he really knows what to do either. COWBOY knows he has to make a decision.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Okay. We'll change direction. COWBOY motions to the squad to come up. They rattle up  and take positions behind the low wall.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Changing direction.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: What, are we lost?

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Joker, shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (to squad) Okay! Listen up! Can you hear me? Adlibs of "Yeah!"

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Okay, we're changing direction. We're heading over that way. COWBOY points over the wall to some ruined buildings across an open space to their Left.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Eightball's gonna go out and see if he can find a way through. EIGHTBALL shrugs, apprehensiuely.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Got it? Adlibs of "Yeah!"

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Eightball ... let's dance. EIGHTBALL slowly gets to his Knees and peers over the wall.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTBALL
dialogues.text: Put a nigger behind the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: HUE
dialogues.text: EIGHTBALL climbs over the low wall and moves cautiously out into the open, heading for the damaged buildings. The squad covers him. EIGHTBALL reaches the buildings and stops to study the smoke-filled square.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: P.O.V. from a concealed position on the second floor of a building on the square, an AK-47 rifle is slowly raised and aimed at EIGHTBALL. EIGHTBALL turns back to wave the rest of the squad up.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The SNIPER fires. EIGHTBALL is hit in the leg. Seen in slow motion, EIGHTBALL twists and crumples to the ground. The LUSTHOG SQUAD fires blindly, wildly, at every door and window in the direction of the shot.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Okay, cease fire! Cease fire, goddamn it! Some of the squad keep firing.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Cool it, goddamn it! Cool it! Cease fire! AdLibs of "Cease fire!" The firing stutters to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, listen up! Did anybody see a sniper? Did anybody see anything?

dialogues.speaker: T.H.E. ROCK
dialogues.text: (down the line) Did anybody see a sniper?

dialogues.speaker: DOC JAY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: DONLON
dialogues.text: Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Negative!

dialogues.speaker: T.H.E. ROCK
dialogues.text: Nothing! Adlibs of "No!"

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Okay, then save your ammo! Nobody fire till I tell you! Seen, in slow, motion, the SNIPER fires again and hits EIGHTBALL in the arm. He screams in pain. The squad opens fire at buildings facing them.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: No, no! Cease fire! Cease fire! Animal, cease fire! Keeping low, DONLON comes up and hands COWBOY the radio.

dialogues.speaker: DONLON
dialogues.text: Cowboy, it's Sergeant Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (into radio) This is Cowboy. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (0.s.) This is Murphy. What is your present position? Over.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Murph, we're receiving enemy sniper fire. Eightball is down. Our position is about half a klick north of checkpoint four. Believe pos- sible strong enemy force occupying buildings in front of us. Request immediate tank support. Over.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Roger. Understand. I'll see what I can do. Over.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Roger. Over and out.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (to Donlon) Stay close.

dialogues.speaker: DONLON
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: thinks hard for a few seconds.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (to squad) Okay, listen up! I think we're being set up for an ambush. I think there may be strong enemy forces in those buildings over there. I've requested tank support. We're gonna sit tight until it comes, but keep your eyes open. If they decide to hit us, we'll have to pull back fast. The SNIPER fires, wounding EIGHTBALL again, this  time in the foot. He shrieks in agony. Again the squad opens fire.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! Hold! Cease your fire, Mother! Cease your fucking fire! The firing stops.

dialogues.speaker: DOC JAY
dialogues.text: Cowboy!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DOC JAY
dialogues.text: We can't leave him out there!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: We're not leaving him! We'll get him when the tank comes up.

dialogues.speaker: DOC JAY
dialogues.text: He's hit three fucking times! He can't wait that long!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: I've seen this before! That sniper's just trying to suck us in one at a time! The SNIPER fires and hits EIGHTBALL in the thigh. His cries echo across the open space ground. ANIMAL MOTHER fires madly.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (shouting) Goddamn it! No! The squad continues firing.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, cease fire! The firing trails off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out there alone!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Cease fire! The firing stops.

dialogues.speaker: DOC JAY
dialogues.text: Man, fuck this, fuck this shit! I'm going out to bring him in!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: No! You stay the fuck down!

dialogues.speaker: DOC JAY
dialogues.text: Cover me!

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: JAY jumps over the wall and, ducking low, zig- Zags across the open ground. The squad fires to cover him. DOC JAY gets there safely and momentarily drops out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! Goddamn it! Okay, cease fire! He's there! Adlibs of "Cease fire!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC JAY, Seen over the sights of the SNIPER's

dialogues.speaker: AK-47,
dialogues.text: drags EIGHTBALL toward cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SNIPER fires. DOC JAY is hit and falls next to EIGHTBALL. The squad opens fire again.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Hold your fire! Hold your fire!!! Cease fire! You can't see the sniper! Save the ammo! Nobody fire till I tell you! Nobody!

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: What the fuck do we do now, Cowboy?

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Gimme that fucking radio. DONLON scuttles over with the radio.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (into radio) Murph? This is Cowboy. Over.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (o.s.) This is Murphy. Over.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Murph, we're in some deep shit. I got two men down. What's the story on that fucking tank? Over.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Sorry, Cowboy. No luck so far with the tank. Will advise. Over.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Roger. Out. (muttering to himself) Numbnut bastards! (to the squad) Okay, listen up!

dialogues.speaker: T.H.E. ROCK
dialogues.text: Listen up!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Can't afford to wait for the tank. I think they're gonna hit us any minute. When they  do we won't have time to pull out. We gotta do it now. Let's get ready to move. No one moves or says anything.

dialogues.speaker: T.H.E. ROCK
dialogues.text: Get ready to pull out!

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Hold it! Hold it! Nobody's pulling out! There's only one fucking sniper out there!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Back off, Mother! I'm calling the plays! I say we're pulling out!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, what about Doc Jay and Eightball?

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: I know it's a shitty thing to do, but we can't refuse to accept the situation.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, we're not leaving Doc Jay and Eightball out there!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Doc Jay and Eightball are wasted! You know that!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Bullshit! Come on, you guys! We gotta go bring'em back! Let's go get em! Let's do it!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Stand down, Mother! That's a direct order!

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Cowboy! Fuck all you assholes! ANIMAL MOTHER jumps over the wall and  runs screaming and firing his M-60. The squad fires to cover him, blasting chunks of mortar and concrete from the buildings.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: (screaming) Fucking son-of-a-bitch! You motherfucker ! Aaagh! Whooo! ANIMAL MOTHER reaches the buildings and drops down against a shattered wall. He calls across the open street.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Doc! Doc! Doc! Where's the sniper? DOC JAY tries to speak.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Doc, where's the sniper? Barely able to move, DOC JAY tries to point in the direction of the SNIPER. Suddenly he and EIGHTBALL are riddled by a burst of automatic fire from the SNIPER, Killing them instantly. ANIMAL MOTHER'S eyes widen in horror.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Shit! ANIMAL MOTHER gets to his feet and edges forward to the corner of the building. He carefully looks around the corner across the square at the black building, from where he thinks the shots were fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot from the SNIPER ricochets off the wall a few inches from his head. He ducks back around the corner, breathing hard. ANIMAL MOTHER looks around and carefully works his way to a safer spot behind another building. He shouts to the squad.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hey, Cowboy!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Doc Jay and Eightball are wasted! There's only one sniper, nothing else. Move up the squad! You're clear up to here! Come on! COWBOY isn't sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (mutters) Son-of-a-bitch. The squad look to him. He takes a couple of thoughtful breaths and decides to go.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Okay, listen up! No-Doze, Stutten, Donlon, Rock--you come with me, we'll take a look! The rest of you stay put and cover our ass! We may be coming back in a big hurry!

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: I'm going with you.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: I'm coming, too.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Okay. (To the others) You all set? Adlibs "Yeah!"

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Let's move out!

dialogues.speaker: T.H.E. ROCK
dialogues.text: Let's do it! The five men clamber over the wall and dash across the broken ground to the smouldering cluster of buildings. When they reach ANIMAL MOTHER he leads them to a street off the square where they duck down against a shattered building. They catch their breath and move forward to the next building, where they crouch down against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: (pointing) Cowboy .. . top of the black building, around the corner. COWBOY cautiously moves to the corner of the building and studies the strange-looking black building which commands the square. Then. he ducks back around the corner, more uncertain than ever what they should do.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Donlon ... give me that radio.  COWBOY moves to DONLON to take the radio. Facing away from the black building, COWBOY does not notice that from the place he has moved to he can be seen. by the SNIPER through a jagged hole in the building. 83

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: The SNIPER's P.O.V. --COWBOY's upper body is just visible through the hole in the building.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Murphy, this is Cowboy. Over! A gunshot reverberates. In slow-motion COWBOY falls.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Cowboy!

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL
dialogues.text: MOTHER starts firing his M-60.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: (shouting) Holy shit! The sniper's got a clean shot through the hole in the wall. Much yelling, shouting and confusion as the men realize where the shot came from.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (shouting) Get him! Get him the fuck outta here!! COWBOY is carried behind the building. All talk at once.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Easy! Easy!

dialogues.speaker: DONLON
dialogues.text: Get him on his back. Adlibs.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (weakly) Oh, I don't believe this shit. Adlibs, fumbling for bandages, etc.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Shut up! You'll be all right, Cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: T.H.E. ROCK
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Cowboy. Four pairs of hands doing things.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (moaning) Uhhh, that son-of-a-bitch!

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: You're gonna be all right.

dialogues.speaker: T.H.E. ROCK
dialogues.text: You're going home, man. You're going home.

dialogues.speaker: DONLON
dialogues.text: Easy, man. Easy. Easy.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Ohhhh, don't shit me, JOKER! Don't shit me!

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: I wouldn't shit you, man. You're my favorite turd. COWBOY begins to lose consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Cowboy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, man. Hang on!

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (coughs) I I can hack it.

dialogues.speaker: T.H.E. ROCK
dialogues.text: You can hack it.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: I can. I-I... COWBOY spits up some blood and dies in JOKER's arms. JOKER bends down and hugs COWBOY. Nobody moves. Then, one by one, they slowly get to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: is the last to get up. They stand looking at the body.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL
dialogues.text: MOTHER leaves two men to continue firing at the SNIPER, and he scuttles around the corner to the group around COWBOY's body. He looks at COWBOY and then at JOKER.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Let's go get some payback. JOKER looks up slowly.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (in cold anger) Okay. ANIMAL MOTHER leads then down a narrow street. They stop to take cover behind a building just off the square.  They have to cross the open. square, ruhich would give the SNIPER a clear shot at them.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: em Give some smoke. He and JOKER toss three smoke grenades into the square. They explode ruith a dull bang. They wait while the square slowly fills with smoke. ANIMAL MOTHER waves and they run out blindly through the thick smoke to the other side of the square.

dialogues.speaker: BUILDING
dialogues.text: They work their way into the shattered, burning building, past twisted steel girders and huge broken chunks of concrete. They come to a place where they have to split up. ANIMAL MOTHER points one way.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Donlon, Rock--that way. You two with me. DONLON and T.H.E. ROCK move off as ordered. JOKER and RAFTERMAN follow ANIMAL MOTHER the other way. They come to another place where they have to choose which way to go.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: (pointing) JOKER, in there! New Guy with me. JOKER cautiously enters one door. ANIMAL MOTHER and RAFTERMAN disappear through the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOKER finds himself in what was the lobby of the building, a large room, which is on fire, with shattered columns, oriental arches, and windows with large decorative grillwork. JOKER inches slowly into the room. He hears a noise, ducks behind a column and peers around it. He sees a small, b lack-clad figure standing at a window - the SNIPER. He raises his rifle, aims and squeezes the trigger. A loud click. In slow motion the SNIPER turns to face JOKER. We see the startled face of a beautiful Vietnamese girl of about fifteen. In slow motion JOKER frantically works the bolt of his M-16. With the hard eyes of a grunt, the SNIPER fires her AK-47 rifle. In slow motion JOKER ducks behind the column, desperately trying to unjam his M-16 rifle. In, slow motion the SNIPER fires and runs down a few steps to get a better shot at JOKER. The bullets from her AK-47 tear large chunks of masonry from the column shielding him. Suddenly the SNIPER's body seems to explode as she is hit by a burst of automatic fire.  RAFTERMAN has come up and fires his M-16 into the girl's body.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: stands trembling against the shattered column. RAFTERMAN snaps another M-16 magazine into place, gestures JOKER to stay put, and moves forward like Supergrunt to check out the rest of the room. It's clear. He moves to the window, and shouts to the two men in the square.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: We got the sniper! The SNIPER lies on the floor, writhing in pain. JOKER and RAFTERMAN cautiously approach her. RAFTERMAN kicks away her AK-47. The two men stare at her in disbelief: The SNIPER is a child, no more than fifteen years old, a slender Eurasian. angel with dark beautiful eyes. They are startled by a faint sound. They dive for cover. They listen. ANIMAL MOTHER calls from behind cover at the other end of the room.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Joker?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: Yo.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: We got the sniper. RAFTERMAN and JOKER circle around the SNIPER as DONLON and T.H.E. ROCK and ANIMAL MOTHER walk up.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: I saved JOKER's ass. I got the sniper. I fucking blew her away. RAFTERMAN laughs hysterically, and kisses his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: Am I bad? Am I a life-taker? Am I a heart- breaker? No one pays any attention to RAFTERMAN. The SNIPER gasps, whimpers. DONLON stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: DONLON
dialogues.text: What's she saying?

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (after a pause) She's praying.

dialogues.speaker: T.H.E. ROCK
dialogues.text: No more boom-boom for this baby-san. There's nothing we can do for her. She's dead meat. ANIMAL MOTHER stares down at the SNIPER.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's get the fuck outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about her?

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Fuck her. Let her rot. The SNIPER prays in Vietnanese.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: We can't just leave her here.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hey, asshole Cowboy's wasted. You're fresh out of friends. I'm running this squad now and I say we leave the gook for the mother-lovin' rats. JOKER stares at ANIMAL MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: I'm not trying to run this squad. I'm just saying we can't leave her like this. ANIMAL MOTHER looks down at the SNIPER.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: (whimpering) Sh... sh-shoot . . . me. Shoot . . . me.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL
dialogues.text: MOTHER looks at JOKER.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL MOTHER
dialogues.text: If you want to waste her, go on, waste her. JOKER looks at the SNIPER. The four men look at JOKER.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: (gasping) Shoot me... shoot . . . me. JOKER slowly lifts his pistol and looks into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot . . . me. JOKER jerks the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The four men are silent. JOKER stares down at the dead girl.

dialogues.speaker: RAFTERMAN
dialogues.text: (laughs) JOKER ... we're gonna have to put you up for the Congressional Medal of... Ugly! (laughs) JOKER looks at RAFTERMAN, blankly.

dialogues.speaker: DONLON
dialogues.text: Hard core, man. Fucking hard core.

dialogues.speaker: CITY--NIGHT.
dialogues.text: The platoon moves through the city, silhouetted against the raging fires. A scene in, hell.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (narration) We have nailed our names in the pages of history enough for today. We hump down to the Perfume River to set in for the night. The marines start to sing.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE PLATOON
dialogues.text: Who's the leader of the club that's made for you and me? M-I-C-K-E-Y M-O-U-S-E. Hey there. Hi there. Ho there. You're as welcome as can be. M-I-C-K-E-Y M-O-U-S-E. Mickey Mouse. (Mickey  Mouse. ) Mickey Mouse. (Mickey Mouse. ) Forever let us hold our banner high. High. High. High. Come along and sing a song and join the jamboree. M-I-C-K-E-Y M-O-U-S-E. Here we go a-marching and a-shouting merrily. M-I-C-K-E-Y M-O-U-S-E. We play fair and we work hard and we're in harmony.

dialogues.speaker: M-O-U-S-E.
dialogues.text: Mickey Mouse. (Mickey Mouse. ) Mickey Mouse. (Mickey Mouse. ) Forever let us hold our banner high. High. High. High. Boys and girls from far and near you're as welcome as can be. M-I-C-K-E-Y M-O-U-S-E. Who's the leader of the club that's made for you and me? M-I-C-K-E-Y M-O-U-S-E. Who is marching coast to coast and far across the sea? M-I-C-K-E-Y M-O-U-S-E. Mickey Mouse. (Mickey Mouse. ) Mickey Mouse. (Mickey Mouse. ) Forever let us hold his banner high. High. High. High. Come along and sing a song and join the family.

dialogues.speaker: JOKER
dialogues.text: (voiceover ) My thoughts drift back to erect nipple wet dreams about Mary Jane Rottencrotch and the Great Homecoming Fuck Fantasy. I am so  happy that I am alive, in one piece and short. I'm in a world of shit . . . yes. But I am alive. And I am not afraid.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE PLATOON
dialogues.text: (singing) Come along and sing this song and join our family.

dialogues.speaker: M-I-C-K-E-Y- M-O-U-S-E
dialogues.text: The marines march off into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE PLATOON
dialogues.text: (singing) Who's the leader of the club that's made for you and me?

dialogues.speaker: M-I-C-K-E-Y M-O-U-S-E
dialogues.text: Hey there! Hi there! Ho there! You're as welcome as can be. Mickey Mouse The sound fades aulay as the scene fades to black.
